Class my_events

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
Fragments.my_events

EventAdapter.OnEventClickListener, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class my_events extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment implements EventAdapter.OnEventClickListener

    • checkForFacility

      public void checkForFacility()
      checks if a facility exists for hosted events list

    • fetchEvents

      public void fetchEvents(List<String> eventIDs, boolean isHosted, my_events.FetchEventsCallback callback)
      fetches events for the list of event IDs. Creates listener since firebase's get() is asynchronous in nature, so it notifies when all events have been loaded.
      Parameters:
      eventIDs - String List of event IDs
      callback - callback to let the calling method know when all the events have been loaded.

    • fetchJoinedEvents

      public void fetchJoinedEvents(String deviceID)
      This method fetches all the events the user joined from firebase currently stored and adds it to a list of events.
      Parameters:
      deviceID - the device ID of the user.

    • createJoinedEventsList

      public void createJoinedEventsList()
      This method creates the joined events list for the user.

    • fetchJoinedEventIDs

      public void fetchJoinedEventIDs(String deviceID, my_events.FetchJoinedEventIDsCallback callback)
      This method fetches all the event IDs from firebase currently stored and adds it to a list of event IDs.
      Parameters:
      deviceID - the device ID of the user.
      callback - to check if all the event IDs have been loaded.
